trans-unit.source: Repairing an Import Job
trans-unit.target: Repairing an Import Job

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Azure Import/Export service may fail to copy some of your files or parts of a file to the Windows Azure Blob service.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Azure Import/Export service may fail to copy some of your files or parts of a file to the Windows Azure Blob service.

trans-unit.source: Some reasons for failures include:
trans-unit.target: Some reasons for failures include:

trans-unit.source: Corrupted files
trans-unit.target: Corrupted files

trans-unit.source: Damaged drives
trans-unit.target: Damaged drives

trans-unit.source: The storage account key changed while the file was being transferred.
trans-unit.target: The storage account key changed while the file was being transferred.

trans-unit.source: You can run the Microsoft Azure Import/Export tool with the import job’s copy log files, and the tool will upload the missing files (or parts of a file) to your Windows Azure storage account to complete import job.
trans-unit.target: You can run the Microsoft Azure Import/Export tool with the import job’s copy log files, and the tool will upload the missing files (or parts of a file) to your Windows Azure storage account to complete import job.

trans-unit.source: The command for repairing an import job is <legacyBold>RepairImport</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: The command for repairing an import job is <legacyBold>RepairImport</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The following parameters can be specified:
trans-unit.target: The following parameters can be specified:

trans-unit.source: <system>/r:</system><RepairFile>
trans-unit.target: <system>/r:</system><RepairFile>

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Path to the repair file, which tracks the progress of the repair, and allows you to resume an interrupted repair.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Path to the repair file, which tracks the progress of the repair, and allows you to resume an interrupted repair.

trans-unit.source: Each drive must have one and only one repair file.
trans-unit.target: Each drive must have one and only one repair file.

trans-unit.source: When you start a repair for a given drive, you will pass in the path to a repair file which does not yet exist.
trans-unit.target: When you start a repair for a given drive, you will pass in the path to a repair file which does not yet exist.

trans-unit.source: To resume an interrupted repair, you should pass in the name of an existing repair file.
trans-unit.target: To resume an interrupted repair, you should pass in the name of an existing repair file.

trans-unit.source: The repair file corresponding to the target drive must always be specified.
trans-unit.target: The repair file corresponding to the target drive must always be specified.

trans-unit.source: <system>/logdir:</system><LogDirectory>
trans-unit.target: <system>/logdir:</system><LogDirectory>

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> The log directory.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> The log directory.

trans-unit.source: Verbose log files will be written to this directory.
trans-unit.target: Verbose log files will be written to this directory.

trans-unit.source: If no log directory is specified, the current directory will be used as the log directory.
trans-unit.target: If no log directory is specified, the current directory will be used as the log directory.

trans-unit.source: <system>/d:</system><TargetDirectories>
trans-unit.target: <system>/d:</system><TargetDirectories>

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> One or more semicolon-separated directories that contain the original files that were imported.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> One or more semicolon-separated directories that contain the original files that were imported.

trans-unit.source: The import drive may also be used, but is not required if alternate locations of original files are available.
trans-unit.target: The import drive may also be used, but is not required if alternate locations of original files are available.

trans-unit.source: <system>/bk:</system><BitLockerKey>
trans-unit.target: <system>/bk:</system><BitLockerKey>

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> You should specify the BitLocker key if you want the tool to unlock an encrypted drive where the original files are available.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> You should specify the BitLocker key if you want the tool to unlock an encrypted drive where the original files are available.

trans-unit.source: <system>/sn:</system><StorageAccountName>
trans-unit.target: <system>/sn:</system><StorageAccountName>

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The name of the storage account for the import job.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The name of the storage account for the import job.

trans-unit.source: <system>/sk:</system><StorageAccountKey>
trans-unit.target: <system>/sk:</system><StorageAccountKey>

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel> if and only if a container SAS is not specified.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel> if and only if a container SAS is not specified.

trans-unit.source: The account key for the storage account for the import job.
trans-unit.target: The account key for the storage account for the import job.

trans-unit.source: <system>/csas:</system><ContainerSas>
trans-unit.target: <system>/csas:</system><ContainerSas>

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel> if and only if the storage account key is not specified.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel> if and only if the storage account key is not specified.

trans-unit.source: The container SAS for accessing the blobs associated with the import job.
trans-unit.target: The container SAS for accessing the blobs associated with the import job.

trans-unit.source: <system>/CopyLogFile:</system><DriveCopyLogFile>
trans-unit.target: <system>/CopyLogFile:</system><DriveCopyLogFile>

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Path to the drive copy log file (either verbose log or error log).
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Path to the drive copy log file (either verbose log or error log).

trans-unit.source: The file is generated by the Windows Azure Import/Export service and can be downloaded from the blob storage associated with the job.
trans-unit.target: The file is generated by the Windows Azure Import/Export service and can be downloaded from the blob storage associated with the job.

trans-unit.source: The copy log file contains information about failed blobs or files which are to be repaired.
trans-unit.target: The copy log file contains information about failed blobs or files which are to be repaired.

trans-unit.source: <system>/PathMapFile:</system><DrivePathMapFile>
trans-unit.target: <system>/PathMapFile:</system><DrivePathMapFile>

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> Path to a text file that can be used to resolve ambiguities if you have multiple files with the same name that you were importing in the same job.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> Path to a text file that can be used to resolve ambiguities if you have multiple files with the same name that you were importing in the same job.

trans-unit.source: The first time the tool is run, it can populate this file with all of the ambiguous names.
trans-unit.target: The first time the tool is run, it can populate this file with all of the ambiguous names.

trans-unit.source: Subsequent runs of the tool will use this file to resolve the ambiguities.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent runs of the tool will use this file to resolve the ambiguities.

trans-unit.source: Using the RepairImport Command
trans-unit.target: Using the RepairImport Command

trans-unit.source: To repair import data by streaming the data over the network, you must specify the directories that contain the original files you were importing using the <codeInline>/d</codeInline> parameter.
trans-unit.target: To repair import data by streaming the data over the network, you must specify the directories that contain the original files you were importing using the <codeInline>/d</codeInline> parameter.

trans-unit.source: You must also specify the copy log file that you downloaded from your storage account.
trans-unit.target: You must also specify the copy log file that you downloaded from your storage account.

trans-unit.source: A typical command line to repair an import job with partial failures looks like:
trans-unit.target: A typical command line to repair an import job with partial failures looks like:

trans-unit.source: The following is an example of a copy log file.
trans-unit.target: The following is an example of a copy log file.

trans-unit.source: In this case, one 64K piece of a file was corrupted on the drive that was shipped for the import job.
trans-unit.target: In this case, one 64K piece of a file was corrupted on the drive that was shipped for the import job.

trans-unit.source: Since this is the only failure indicated, the rest of the blobs in the job were successfully imported.
trans-unit.target: Since this is the only failure indicated, the rest of the blobs in the job were successfully imported.

trans-unit.source: When this copy log is passed to the Azure Import/Export tool, the tool will try to finish the import for this file by copying the missing contents across the network.
trans-unit.target: When this copy log is passed to the Azure Import/Export tool, the tool will try to finish the import for this file by copying the missing contents across the network.

trans-unit.source: Following the example above, the tool will look for the original file <codeInline>\animals\koala.jpg</codeInline> within the two directories <codeInline>C:\Users\bob\Pictures</codeInline> and <codeInline>X:\BobBackup\photos</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Following the example above, the tool will look for the original file <codeInline>\animals\koala.jpg</codeInline> within the two directories <codeInline>C:\Users\bob\Pictures</codeInline> and <codeInline>X:\BobBackup\photos</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: If the file <codeInline>C:\Users\bob\Pictures\animals\koala.jpg</codeInline> exists, the Azure Import/Export tool will copy the missing range of data to the corresponding blob <codeInline>http://bobmediaaccount.blob.core.windows.net/pictures/animals/koala.jpg</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: If the file <codeInline>C:\Users\bob\Pictures\animals\koala.jpg</codeInline> exists, the Azure Import/Export tool will copy the missing range of data to the corresponding blob <codeInline>http://bobmediaaccount.blob.core.windows.net/pictures/animals/koala.jpg</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Resolving Conflicts When Using RepairImport
trans-unit.target: Resolving Conflicts When Using RepairImport

trans-unit.source: In some situations, the tool may not be able to find or open the necessary file for one of the following reasons: the file could not be found, the file is not accessible, the file name is ambiguous, or the content of the file is no longer correct.
trans-unit.target: In some situations, the tool may not be able to find or open the necessary file for one of the following reasons: the file could not be found, the file is not accessible, the file name is ambiguous, or the content of the file is no longer correct.

trans-unit.source: An ambiguous error could occur if the tool is trying to locate <codeInline>\animals\koala.jpg</codeInline> and there is a file with that name under both <codeInline>C:\Users\bob\pictures</codeInline> and <codeInline>X:\BobBackup\photos</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: An ambiguous error could occur if the tool is trying to locate <codeInline>\animals\koala.jpg</codeInline> and there is a file with that name under both <codeInline>C:\Users\bob\pictures</codeInline> and <codeInline>X:\BobBackup\photos</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: That is, both <codeInline>C:\Users\bob\pictures\animals\koala.jpg</codeInline> and <codeInline>X:\BobBackup\photos\animals\koala.jpg</codeInline> exist on the import job drives.
trans-unit.target: That is, both <codeInline>C:\Users\bob\pictures\animals\koala.jpg</codeInline> and <codeInline>X:\BobBackup\photos\animals\koala.jpg</codeInline> exist on the import job drives.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>/PathMapFile</codeInline> option will allow you to resolve these errors.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>/PathMapFile</codeInline> option will allow you to resolve these errors.

trans-unit.source: You can specify the name of the file which will contains the list of files that the tool was not able to correctly identify.
trans-unit.target: You can specify the name of the file which will contains the list of files that the tool was not able to correctly identify.

trans-unit.source: The following is an example command line that would populate <codeInline>9WM35C2V_pathmap.txt</codeInline>:
trans-unit.target: The following is an example command line that would populate <codeInline>9WM35C2V_pathmap.txt</codeInline>:

trans-unit.source: The tool will then write the problematic file paths to <codeInline>9WM35C2V_pathmap.txt</codeInline>, one on each line.
trans-unit.target: The tool will then write the problematic file paths to <codeInline>9WM35C2V_pathmap.txt</codeInline>, one on each line.

trans-unit.source: For instance, the file may contain the following entries after running the command:
trans-unit.target: For instance, the file may contain the following entries after running the command:

trans-unit.source: For each file in the list, you should attempt to locate and open the file to ensure it is available to the tool.
trans-unit.target: For each file in the list, you should attempt to locate and open the file to ensure it is available to the tool.

trans-unit.source: If you wish to tell the tool explicitly where to find a file, you can modify the path map file and add the path to each file on the same line, separated by a tab character:
trans-unit.target: If you wish to tell the tool explicitly where to find a file, you can modify the path map file and add the path to each file on the same line, separated by a tab character:

trans-unit.source: After making the necessary files available to the tool, or updating the path map file, you can rerun the tool to complete the import process.
trans-unit.target: After making the necessary files available to the tool, or updating the path map file, you can rerun the tool to complete the import process.
